title: Authors and Citation
text: Emi Tanaka. Author, maintainer. Sue Welham. Contributor, copyright holder. Salvador Gezan. Contributor. Suzanne Clark. Contributor. Andrew Mead. Contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Tanaka E (2025). smbdata: Data "Statistical Methods Biology". R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/emitanaka/smbdata.
code: @Manual{,   title = {smbdata: Data from "Statistical Methods in Biology"},   author = {Emi Tanaka},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/emitanaka/smbdata}, }

title: Data from
text: package provides data book Welham et al. (2015) “Statistical Methods Biology” added acknowledgement permission authors.

title: Data from
text: can install development version smbdata like :

title: Air temperature — airtemp
text: Air temperature measurements (°C) recorded approximately 9 .m. 100 days 2006 using two instruments: standard glass mercury dry-bulb thermometer new electronic dry-bulb thermistor probe. day, dataset includes day number paired temperature readings devices, enabling direct comparison established new measurement methods.

title: Air temperature — airtemp
text: data frame 100 rows 4 variables: Unit Factor. Unique identifier observation. DayNo Integer. Day number measurement taken. Mercury Numeric. Temperature (degrees Celsius) measured using mercury thermometer. Thermistor Numeric. Temperature (degrees Celsius) measured using thermistor thermometer.

title: Air temperature — airtemp
text: Welham, S. J., Gezan, S. ., Clark, S. J., Mead, . (2015) Statistical Methods Biology: Design analysis experiments regression

title: Air temperature — airtemp
code: # a simple linear regression fit_ab <- lm(Thermistor ~ Mercury, data = airtemp) # let intercept be 0 fit_b <- lm(Thermistor ~ 0 + Mercury, data = airtemp) # test if intercept = 0 anova(fit_b, fit_ab) #> Analysis of Variance Table #>  #> Model 1: Thermistor ~ 0 + Mercury #> Model 2: Thermistor ~ Mercury #>   Res.Df    RSS Df Sum of Sq      F Pr(>F) #> 1     99 63.953                            #> 2     98 62.299  1    1.6539 2.6017   0.11 # test if slope is equal to 1, given intercept = 0 fit_1 <- lm(Thermistor ~ 0 + offset(Mercury), data = airtemp) anova(fit_1, fit_b) #> Analysis of Variance Table #>  #> Model 1: Thermistor ~ 0 + offset(Mercury) #> Model 2: Thermistor ~ 0 + Mercury #>   Res.Df    RSS Df Sum of Sq      F    Pr(>F)     #> 1    100 72.310                                   #> 2     99 63.953  1     8.357 12.937 0.0005048 *** #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 ‘***’ 0.001 ‘**’ 0.01 ‘*’ 0.05 ‘.’ 0.1 ‘ ’ 1

title: Pea aphids survey — aphids
text: dataset comes ecological survey pea aphid (Acyrthosiphon pisum). three fields, 15 randomly selected triplets adjacent bean plants inspected, total number pea aphids triplet recorded. dataset includes explanatory factor Field (three levels), Sample identifier 15 sampling locations within field, response variable AphidCount, representing total aphid count per sample, used assess whether aphid infestation differs among fields.

title: Pea aphids survey — aphids
text: data frame 45 rows 4 variables: ID, Field, Sample, AphidCount. ID Factor. Unique identifier observation. Field Factor. Identifier field sample collected. Sample Factor. Sample point number within field. AphidCount Integer. Number aphids counted sample.

title: Pea aphids survey — aphids
text: Welham, S. J., Gezan, S. ., Clark, S. J., Mead, . (2015) Statistical Methods Biology: Design analysis experiments regression

title: Pea aphids survey — aphids
code: fit <- glm(AphidCount ~ Field, family = poisson(), data = aphids)

title: Beetle mating — beetles
text: dataset comes completely randomized experiment investigating viability interspecies intraspecies mating two willow beetle species (Phratora vitellinae Phratora vulgatissima). Females species mated males either species, giving four treatments 10 replicates per treatment. dataset includes factor Treatment, identifying mating combination, response variable Eggs, records number eggs laid female, used compare reproductive outcomes across mating types.

title: Beetle mating — beetles
text: data frame 5 variables: DFemale, Treatment, Species, MateType, Eggs. DFemale Factor. Unique identifier female subject experiment. Treatment Factor. Experimental treatment group assigned female. Species Factor. Species designation female study. MateType Factor. Type mate provided female ("Inter" interspecific "Intra" intraspecific, relevant). Eggs Integer. Number eggs laid female observation period.

title: Beetle mating — beetles
text: Welham, S. J., Gezan, S. ., Clark, S. J., Mead, . (2015) Statistical Methods Biology: Design analysis experiments regression Peacock, L., Batley, J., Dungait, J. . J., Barker, J. H. ., Powers, S. J. & Karp, . (2004). comparative study interspecies mating Phratora vulgatissima P. vitellinae using behavioural tests molecular markers. Entomologia Experimentalis et Applicata, 110(3), 231–241.

title: Beetle mating — beetles
code: fit <- lm(log10(Eggs) ~ Species * MateType, data = beetles) anova(fit) #> Analysis of Variance Table #>  #> Response: log10(Eggs) #>                  Df  Sum Sq Mean Sq F value    Pr(>F)     #> Species           1 0.90307 0.90307 37.9324 4.264e-07 *** #> MateType          1 0.38073 0.38073 15.9919 0.0003024 *** #> Species:MateType  1 0.09135 0.09135  3.8369 0.0579165 .   #> Residuals        36 0.85707 0.02381                       #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 ‘***’ 0.001 ‘**’ 0.01 ‘*’ 0.05 ‘.’ 0.1 ‘ ’ 1

title: Measuring soil microbial biomass — biomassc
text: experiment conducted investigate effects procedural modifications measurements soil microbial biomass carbon, expressed mg C per kg soil. study employed 2 × 3 × 2 factorial design, testing two sieve sizes, three sample weights, two shaking times, resulting 12 distinct treatment combinations. combination replicated four times completely randomized design. response variable recorded amount microbial carbon biomass (C). purpose analysis quantify main effects possible interactions among sieve size, sample weight, shaking time, well determine whether alternative procedures yield results within 10

title: Measuring soil microbial biomass — biomassc
text: data frame 5 variables: DSample, Size, Weight, Time, C. DSample Factor. Experimental unit identifier, representing replicate number. Size Factor. Sieve size used processing soil samples ("Small" "Large"). Weight Integer. Sample weight used protocol. Time Integer. Duration minutes shaking sample processing. C Integer. Microbial biomass carbon soil, measured mg C per kg soil.

title: Measuring soil microbial biomass — biomassc
text: Welham, S. J., Gezan, S. ., Clark, S. J., Mead, . (2015) Statistical Methods Biology: Design analysis experiments regression

title: Measuring soil microbial biomass — biomassc
code: fit <- lm(C ~ Size * Weight * Time,           data = biomassc |>              transform(Weight = factor(Weight),                        Time = factor(Time))) anova(fit) #> Analysis of Variance Table #>  #> Response: C #>                  Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value    Pr(>F)     #> Size              1  80524   80524 17.1140 0.0002018 *** #> Weight            2  12061    6030  1.2816 0.2899424     #> Time              1 179585  179585 38.1678 4.022e-07 *** #> Size:Weight       2  10543    5272  1.1204 0.3372606     #> Size:Time         1     65      65  0.0139 0.9068521     #> Weight:Time       2   8855    4428  0.9410 0.3996224     #> Size:Weight:Time  2   5745    2872  0.6105 0.5486241     #> Residuals        36 169386    4705                       #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 ‘***’ 0.001 ‘**’ 0.01 ‘*’ 0.05 ‘.’ 0.1 ‘ ’ 1

title: Sreening for pathogenicity — brassica
text: experiment conducted assess pathogenicity various fungal isolates oilseed rape seedlings. Fungal isolates obtained two Brassica species, labeled B (Species), included nine isolates group four group B (Isolate). experimental design involved three replicate runs across time (Rep), replicate using trays seedlings—either 22 23 seedlings per tray (Tray, 13 levels; variate: Seedlings)—exposed toeach isolate. Five days inoculation, number resistant seedlings showing signs infection (Resistant) recorded tray, percentage resistant seedlings used response variable analysis. design allows evaluation differences pathogenicity among isolates, considering variability due species, replicates, tray sizes.

title: Sreening for pathogenicity — brassica
text: data frame 9 variables: ID, Rep, Tray, Species, Isolate, TypeA, TypeB, Seedlings, Resistant. ID Factor. Unique identifier observation (row) dataset. Rep Factor. Replicate/run number experiment (1–3), representing separate experimental runs across time. Tray Factor. Tray identifier batch seedlings tested replicate (13 levels). Species Factor. Brassica species fungal isolate collected ("" "B"). Isolate Factor. Identifier fungal isolate tested (nine levels across groups; unique within Species). TypeA Integer. Isolate identifier re-coded group isolates (repeats "Isolate" value group , NA coding group B). TypeB Integer. Isolate identifier re-coded group B isolates (repeats "Isolate" value group B, NA coding group ). Seedlings Integer. Number seedlings tested per tray (22 23). Resistant Integer. Number seedlings tray showing signs infection (.e., counted resistant) five days inoculation.

title: Sreening for pathogenicity — brassica
text: Welham, S. J., Gezan, S. ., Clark, S. J., Mead, . (2015) Statistical Methods Biology: Design analysis experiments regression

title: Sreening for pathogenicity — brassica
code: fit <- aov(log(P / (100 - P)) ~ Species / Isolate + Error(Rep / Tray),            data = brassica |>              transform(P = 100 * (Resistant + 1) / (Seedlings + 2))) summary(fit) #>  #> Error: Rep #>           Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value Pr(>F) #> Residuals  2  1.866  0.9332                #>  #> Error: Rep:Tray #>                 Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value   Pr(>F)     #> Species          1   4.29   4.290   29.84 1.29e-05 *** #> Species:Isolate 11  24.07   2.188   15.22 2.97e-08 *** #> Residuals       24   3.45   0.144                      #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 ‘***’ 0.001 ‘**’ 0.01 ‘*’ 0.05 ‘.’ 0.1 ‘ ’ 1

title: Calcium pot trial — calcium
text: experiment conducted assess impact four different calcium concentrations (levels = 1, B = 5, C = 10, D = 20) root growth plants. study followed completely randomized design, treatment assigned five individual plants growing separate pots, total 20  pots. end experiment, total root length (cm) measured pot. dataset  contains three columns: Pot, unique identifier pot; Calcium, factor indicating assigned  calcium treatment level; Length, measured total root length pot. structure allows comparison root growth across different calcium concentration treatments.

title: Calcium pot trial — calcium
text: data frame 3 variables: Pot, Calcium, Length. #' @format data frame following variables: Pot Factor. Unique identifier pot/experimental unit. Calcium Factor. Treatment group indicating relative concentration calcium applied pot (levels: "" = 1, "B" = 5, "C" = 10, "D" = 20). Length Integer. Total root length (centimeters) measured pot end experiment.

title: Calcium pot trial — calcium
text: Welham, S. J., Gezan, S. ., Clark, S. J., Mead, . (2015) Statistical Methods Biology: Design analysis experiments regression

title: Calcium pot trial — calcium
code: anova(lm(Length ~ Calcium, data = calcium)) #> Analysis of Variance Table #>  #> Response: Length #>           Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value    Pr(>F)     #> Calcium    3 2462.9  820.98  10.753 0.0004092 *** #> Residuals 16 1221.6   76.35                       #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 ‘***’ 0.001 ‘**’ 0.01 ‘*’ 0.05 ‘.’ 0.1 ‘ ’ 1

what: Calcium pot trial with alternative representation — calcium2
title: Calcium pot trial with alternative representation — calcium2
text: experiment, four relative concentrations calcium (= 1, B = 5, C = 10, D = 20) applied five individual plants, treatments assigned completely randomized design across 20 pots. experimental period, total root length (centimeters) plant measured. resulting dataset includes root length measurements set dummy variables representing levels Calcium treatment factor. structure facilitates statistical analysis effects different calcium concentrations plant root growth.

title: Calcium pot trial with alternative representation — calcium2
Calcium pot trial with alternative representation — calcium2
text: data frame 7 variables: Pot, Calcium, Length, d1, d2, d3, d4. Pot Factor. Unique identifier pot (experimental unit). Calcium Factor. Calcium treatment group pot, levels "" = 1, "B" = 5, "C" = 10, "D" = 20. Length Integer. Total root length (centimeters) measured pot end experiment. d1 Integer. Dummy variable indicating membership calcium level "" (1 Calcium = "", 0 otherwise). d2 Integer. Dummy variable indicating membership calcium level "B" (1 Calcium = "B", 0 otherwise). d3 Integer. Dummy variable indicating membership calcium level "C" (1 Calcium = "C", 0 otherwise). d4 Integer. Dummy variable indicating membership calcium level "D" (1 Calcium = "D", 0 otherwise).

title: Calcium pot trial with alternative representation — calcium2
text: Welham, S. J., Gezan, S. ., Clark, S. J., Mead, . (2015) Statistical Methods Biology: Design analysis experiments regression

title: Calcium pot trial with alternative representation — calcium2
ELISA calibration — calibrate
text: calibration experiment conducted develop appropriate protocol experimental procedure. study tested three preparation methods (Prep) four initial concentrations (Conc), combined completely randomized design two replicates per combination. Absorbance values measured solution application ELISA plate recorded dataset. data comprise measured absorbances (Absorbance), preparation method, initial concentration unit. One observation (unit 9) excluded analysis due suspected contamination marked missing.

title: ELISA calibration — calibrate

title: Weed competition experiment — competition
text: dataset arises split-plot experiment designed assess competitive effects different weed species impact irrigation grain yield winter wheat. experimental design included four blocks (Block), block containing two whole plots assigned either irrigation irrigation (Irrigation, WholePlot). whole plot divided four subplots (Subplot), different weed species treatments (none, , Ga, Sm; Species) applied. measured outcome grain yield (Grain) subplot. hierarchical, nested structure experiment (Block/WholePlot/Subplot) allows analysis main effects interactions weed species irrigation, accounting variation blocks plots.

Identifier subplot within whole plot (four per whole plot,  corresponding weed species treatments). Irrigation Factor. Irrigation treatment applied whole plot ("yes" ""). Species Factor. Weed species sown subplot ("-", "", "Ga", "Sm"; "-" denotes weeds). Grain Numeric. Grain yield (appropriate units) measured subplot winter wheat.

Inoculation chambers containing aphids exposed conidial showers one eight time periods, ranging 0 80 minutes (Time). actual conidial dose received treatment estimated counting spores deposited slides (Conidia) placed chambers. combination time period source replicated across two experimental runs (Run), separate sources used replicate. time zero category served negative control , conidia present time, resulting zero counts confirm absence slide contamination; category excluded analysis. resulting dataset supports investigation relationship exposure time, conidial dose, source type replicated experimental conditions.

title: Aphid catch — examine
text: EXAMINE project collected data 50 suction trap locations across Europe explore environmental landscape factors affecting aphid flight timing abundance. dataset specifically focuses Julian day first capture aphid species Myzus persicae site 1995. Explanatory variables include geographical information (latitude, longitude, altitude), ten meteorologicalvariables (monthly rainfall October 1994 May 1995, mean temperature coldest 30-day period, mean temperature subsequent 60-day period), eight land-use variables representing proportion land within 75 km radius used different purposes (forest types, agricultural land, urban areas, water bodies). factors selected potential influence aphid migration patterns, earlier flight dates expected warmer drier regions. dataset enables analysis geography, climate, landscape usage affect seasonal timing aphid arrival across Europe.

Total number prey items offered dish (always 6).

text: Welham, S. J., Gezan, S. ., Clark, S. J., Mead, . (2015) Statistical Methods Biology: Design analysis experiments regression

title: Weed abundance — sosr
text: dataset comes UK-wide Farm Scale Evaluations (FSEs) conducted 2000 2003 assess ecological effects genetically modified (GM) herbicide-resistant versus conventional crop management spring oilseed rape. field divided two half-fields received either GM conventional treatment (Treatment), total 62 fields sampled three years (Year) 37 different farms (Farm). field within farm uniquely numbered (Field), half-fields labelled (DHalf) according treatment allocation. half-field, total abundance weeds (variate Weeds) recorded last GM herbicide application (“post-herbicide”), baseline seedbank density (variate Seedbank) measured sowing. excluding fields missing suspect seedbank data, dataset comprises 118 half-field observations 59 fields. structure enables analysis GM conventional management regimes impact weed abundance, controlling initial differences seedbank densities across spatially temporally replicated field trial.

title: Weed abundance — sosr
text: data frame 8 variables: ID, Farm, Field, DHalf, Year, Treatment, Weeds, Seedbank. ID Factor. Unique identifier half-field observation. Farm Factor. Identifier farm (37 farms total). Field Factor. Field number within farm (usually 1–3, since different fields used across years within farms). DHalf Factor. Half-field number within field (1 2), corresponding experimental treatment allocation. Year Integer. Year trial, coded chronologically 1 (2000), 2 (2001), 3 (2002). Treatment Factor. Management regime applied half-field: "C" (conventional) "GM" (genetically modified herbicide-resistant crop). Weeds Integer. Total weed abundance recorded half-field last GM herbicide application. Seedbank Integer. Seedbank density (initial seed count) measured half-field sowing.

title: Weed abundance — sosr
text: Welham, S. J., Gezan, S. ., Clark, S. J., Mead, . (2015) Statistical Methods Biology: Design analysis experiments regression

title: Rothamsted monthly mean temperature — temperature
text: dataset contains monthly mean temperatures recorded Rothamsted Experimental Station 1891 1990. observation represents mean temperature (variate Temperature) specific month year within 100-year period. data suitable time series analysis expected exhibit annual cyclic pattern, making appropriate modeling using trigonometric regression methods.

title: Rothamsted monthly mean temperature — temperature
text: data frame 3 variables: MonthName, Month, Temperature. MonthName Factor. Name month (e.g., "January", "February"). Month Integer. Numeric code month (1 = January, ..., 12 = December). Temperature Numeric. Mean temperature month (degrees Celsius).

title: Rothamsted monthly mean temperature — temperature
text: Welham, S. J., Gezan, S. ., Clark, S. J., Mead, . (2015) Statistical Methods Biology: Design analysis experiments regression

title: Thousand grain weights — tgw
text: field experiment conducted using completely randomized design evaluate effect growth regulator application oilseed rape variety (B N) seed production, six replicates per treatment combination. trial, plots grazed pigeons, raising concerns damage influence plant growth seed development. percentage plot's area affected bird grazing (variate Damage, recorded nearest 10 percent) measured allow adjustment analysis. main response variable thousand grain weight (TGW), treatment combinations reflect four factorial combinations growth regulator presence/absence variety, coded single factor (Trt: +B, +N, -B, -N). dataset enables investigation effects variety growth regulator seed weight, controlling confounding influence bird grazing damage.

title: Thousand grain weights — tgw
text: data frame 6 variables: Plot, GR, Variety, Trt, Damage, TGW. Plot Factor. Unique identifier experimental plot. GR Factor. Growth regulator application: "+" (growth regulator) "-" (without growth regulator). Variety Factor. Oilseed rape variety: "B" "N". Trt Factor. Treatment combination label indicating growth regulator variety (one "+B", "+N", "-B", "-N"). Damage Integer. Percentage plot area grazed pigeons, recorded nearest 10 percent. TGW Numeric. Thousand grain weight (TGW) response, measuring average weight (grams) 1000 seeds plot.

title: Thousand grain weights — tgw
text: Welham, S. J., Gezan, S. ., Clark, S. J., Mead, . (2015) Statistical Methods Biology: Design analysis experiments regression

title: Crop transect beetle counts — transect
text: pilot study carried examine entry pattern insect pest (beetles) susceptible crop. Researchers hypothesized beetles infiltrate crop field edge, advancing toward centre. Following initial detection beetles field, transect established running field edge toward centre, beetle sampling conducted 2-meter intervals. sampling point, beetles counted four randomly selected plants provide replicate measurements distance. resulting data consist distance crop edge (variate Distance) corresponding beetle count (variate Count) sampled plant. structure allows analysis spatial trends beetle infestation across field transect.

title: Crop transect beetle counts — transect
text: data frame 4 variables: DPlant, Distance, fDist, Count. DPlant Factor. Unique identifier sampled plant. Distance Integer. Distance (meters) edge field along transect plant sampled. fDist Factor. Factor-level code distance group along transect. Count Integer. Number beetles counted sampled plant.

title: Crop transect beetle counts — transect
text: Welham, S. J., Gezan, S. ., Clark, S. J., Mead, . (2015) Statistical Methods Biology: Design analysis experiments regression

title: Diploid wheat — triticum
text: dataset collected investigate morphological characteristics associated seed weight line diploid wheat (Triticum monococcum). Measurements taken 190 randomly selected seeds, recording five traits seed: weight (mg), diameter (mm), length (mm), moisture content (percentage), endosperm hardness (index value single-kernel characterization system). seed uniquely identified variable DSeed. primary aim study identify variables, particularly seed length, contribute variation seed weight. dataset enables analysis relationships among seed traits within genetically uniform wheat line.

title: Diploid wheat — triticum
text: data frame 6 variables: DSeed, Weight, Length, Diameter, Moisture, Hardness. DSeed Factor. Unique identifier seed. Weight Numeric. Weight seed (milligrams, mg). Length Numeric. Length seed (millimeters, mm). Diameter Numeric. Diameter seed (millimeters, mm). Moisture Numeric. Moisture content seed (percentage). Hardness Numeric. Endosperm hardness, measured single-kernel characterization system index value.

title: Diploid wheat — triticum
text: Welham, S. J., Gezan, S. ., Clark, S. J., Mead, . (2015) Statistical Methods Biology: Design analysis experiments regression

title: Voltage response — voltage
text: experiment carried assess affinity sugar transporter protein plant cells measuring electric current (Km) response range substrate-associated voltages. Nine voltage levels, ranging -160 0 mV, tested (Voltage), experiment followed randomized complete block design two blocks corresponding separate experimental occasions (Rep). combination, one observation recorded per block (DUnit, reflecting individual measurement units within replicate). dataset enables analysis membrane voltage influences transporter activity, blocking account variation experimental runs.

title: Voltage response — voltage
text: data frame 5 variables: ID, Rep, DUnit, Voltage, Km. ID Factor. Unique identifier observation. Rep Factor. Block number, corresponding experimental occasion (replicate). DUnit Factor. Measurement unit within replicate (used place actual plot plant randomization). Voltage Integer. Membrane voltage applied (millivolts, mV; values range -160 0). Km Numeric. Measured electric current respective voltage (unit appropriate current, e.g., microamperes).

title: Voltage response — voltage

title: Weed seed abundance — weedseed
text: observational study conducted explore relationship seed production plant characteristics rye-grass. 17 24 samples collected four study sites (Site: C, L, P, W). sample point, total number seeds per square meter (TotalSeed), average head length millimeters (HLength), average number spikelets per head (Spikelets) measured. dataset facilitates analysis head length spikelet count may influence seed yield across multiple field sites.

title: Weed seed abundance — weedseed
text: data frame 5 variables: Sample, Site, HLength, Spikelets, TotalSeed. Sample Factor. Unique identifier sample point. Site Factor. Study site sample collected (levels: "C", "L", "P", "W"). HLength Numeric. Average head length rye-grass plants sampling point (millimeters, mm). Spikelets Numeric. Average number spikelets per head sampling point. TotalSeed Integer. Total number seeds per square meter sampling point.

title: Weed seed abundance — weedseed

title: Wheat yields — wheat
text: field trial, yields standard commercial wheat variety new ‘improved’ variety compared assess differences average performance. Seven small plots planted variety, resulting yield measurements total 14 plots. Yields determined plot standardized tonnes per hectare (t/ha). primary objective study evaluate whether new variety offers significant advantage yield standard commercial type.

title: Wheat yields — wheat
text: data frame 3 variables: DPlot, Variety, Yield. DPlot Factor. Unique identifier plot field trial. Variety Factor. Wheat variety grown plot ("Commercial" "Improved"). Yield Numeric. Grain yield plot, measured tonnes per hectare (t/ha).

title: Wheat yields — wheat

title: Willow beetle measurements — willow
text: sample 50 willow beetles (Phratora vulgatissima) collected willow crop near Bristol, UK, investigate morphological variation within population. beetle, measurements taken total body length width, among characteristics. dataset enables analysis size variation potential relationships morphological traits willow beetles location.

title: Willow beetle measurements — willow
text: data frame 3 variables: DBeetle, Length, Width. DBeetle Factor. Unique identifier beetle sample. Length Numeric. Total body length beetle (millimeters, mm). Width Numeric. Maximum body width beetle (millimeters, mm).
